snippet: Men armed with machetes surrounded the activist, Mohammad Nazim Uddin, and slashed his head, then shot him, a police official said.
abstract: Activist law student Mohammad Nazim Uddin is murdered on street by machete-wielding group of men in Dhaka, Bangladesh; killing of vocal atheist, whose family had pleaded with him to curb his use of social media to critique Bangladeshi government and Islamist groups, chills country's embattled secular movement.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and MAHER SATTAR
byline.contributor: Ellen Barry reported from New Delhi, and Maher Sattar from Dhaka, Bangladesh.

lead_paragraph: Men armed with machetes surrounded the activist, Mohammad Nazim Uddin, and slashed his head, then shot him, a police official said.

headline.main: Bangladesh Activist Is Killed After Criticizing Militants
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Sees Another Brutal Killing of an Activist
